alert.note: Alert for Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:24PM MDT until April 15 at 10:17AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Poplar River Near Poplar affecting Roosevelt County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Poplar River...including Poplar...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Poplar River Near Poplar. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low lying areas near gage site begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM MDT Tuesday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 07/10/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
